channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Can AI be an artist?’ A Sotheby’s auction tests the answer, while human artists protest AI training
item.description: The auction house will sell a painting created by a humanoid robot.

item.title: Wall Street’s Latest Flood: Private Credit
item.description: Private credit is a treacherous swamp full of opportunists. Is your consultant capable of defying the formidable odds of success?

item.title: Democrats’ Trump-Hitler Fable Is A Military-Grade Psyop
item.description: It's a multistage psychological operation to reenergize demoralized Harris supporters and reduce turnout among Trump supporters.

item.title: Unlocking Stock Market Success: Why You Should Embrace the Skew
item.description: By learning to appreciate positive skew and its associated tail events, investors can unlock the full potential of stock market gains.

item.title: Tesla now says cheaper cars are on the horizon—including possibly the rumored Model 2—after reportedly scrapping its plans for a $25,000 vehicle earlier this year
item.description: The company had long promised “an even more affordable car” after the Model S and Model 3.

item.title: GOP congressman: U.S. should target North Koreans if they enter Ukraine war on Russia's side
item.description: A senior Republican lawmaker said the U.S. should consider taking "direct military action" against North Korean troops if they enter the war in Ukrain...

item.title: Yes, Kamala Harris Really Is That Stupid
item.description: Stupid people like Kamala Harris bumble their way into the halls of power all the time.

item.title: Trump camp says Dem rhetoric 'directly to blame' for past assassination attempts

item.title: Harris Is Attacking Trump as a Conventional Republican
item.description: But her criticisms just remind voters of the good stuff he did.

item.title: Kamala Harris Says She Values Her Staff Despite 92 Percent Office Turnover Rate As Vice President
item.description: The vice president testified to her own virtues with a straight face in prime time despite a nearly 92 percent staff turnover rate.

item.title: Vast majority of Americans support photo ID requirement to vote, new poll says
item.description: A Gallup Poll released on Thursday shows that most Americans support having photo identification as a requirement to vote in elections.

item.title: Jump Trading is offering 4-day-a-week tech jobs with $175K salaries, but they come with a catch
item.description: The trading firm is hiring a “weekend warrior,” emphasis on the warrior.

item.title: Pro-life groups slam Harris for uncompromising abortion position: 'Christians are not welcome'

item.title: Princeton’s Misguided Attempt to Erase Its Former President’s Legacy
item.description: Princeton seems to be edging toward cancellation of John Witherspoon based on an incomplete and misleading historical account.

item.title: The Alternative Investment Gender Gap: Marketing to Female Clients
item.description: What are women's favorite alternative investments? What marketing strategies resonate with women, and which one's don't?

item.title: Harris' 'mixed messages' on natural gas production could cost her pivotal Pennsylvania
item.description: Many view Vice President Kamala Harris' ambiguity on energy as a sign she may crack down on fracking and natural gas exploration if elected.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: Prominent data scientist on latest election odds: Trump leads, but Harris is gaining
item.description: Thomas Miller, a data scientist and professor at Northwestern University, says the 2024 presidential race has whipsawed over the past several weeks.

item.title: Taiwan’s fate, &c.
item.description: On an island and its enemy; a death-row case in Japan; lowriding in America; scenes from Central Park; and more.

item.title: ‘Big Tech’ Fears of the Past Show How We Have the Wrong Fears in the Present
item.description: The idea that a big company is something that will eventually become an unstoppably dominant giant is wrong.

item.title: 'Walz Failed' painted on roof of Minnesota governor's mansion
item.description: Minnesota authorities have launched an investigation after "Walz Failed" was painted on the roof of the governor's mansion in St. Paul.

item.title: Trump would fire Jack Smith 'within 2 seconds' if reelected
item.description: Former President Donald Trump said special counsel Jack Smith would be gone immediately if he's reelected in November.

item.title: Harris Finally Crashes and Burns on CNN
item.description: Even CNN’s own analysts panned the Democratic nominee’s performance. This was her first authentic campaign disaster.
